name: DEADWAR: OLD LIES
detailed_description:
"Story about..."

DEADWAR is a story about cruelty of war. Game is focused on internal experience of main character. In DEADWAR you play as Steve. Steve is a commander of a special unit. Military service is a tradition in his family, his father was pilot, who died during service. Steve decided to continue "family tradition". Story of game takes place when a new president coming to power. Guerrilla war begins, but with whom...?


You know wars as historical events on a timeline, but have you ever thought about what it really is?

About game

DEADWAR: OLD LIES is a singleplayer first-person shooter with two alternative ending. Game uses one of the newer versions CryEngine V with DirectX 12 support and optional VR support.

Keys feature

  • Singleplayer first-person shooter game with two alternative ending
  • DX12 support
  • Game working on CryEngine V
  • Free to play without micropayments

short_description: DEADWAR: OLD LIES - story about life, family, war, money... Are you putting all your eggs in one basket? DEADWAR is a singleplayer game, FPS, Free to Play, without micropayments. In DEADWAR, you play as Steve, a veteran of war who will change the course of history.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 7 64-bit
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 750TI 2GB / AMD Radeon R7 370 2GB
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 10 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
mac_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Ubuntu 14 64-bit
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 750TI 2GB/ AMD Radeon R7 370 2GB
  • Storage: 10 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: DEADWAR on Linux also uses the SDL2 library runtime.
linux_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
